description_txt: stated on January 18, 2017 in a Senate confirmation hearing:
quote_txt: "Some countries are contributing (peacekeeping) troops because they're making money off of them."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2017 in a state of the county speech:
quote_txt: Miami-Dade is "the first community in the world to break the cycle of local transmission of the Zika virus."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2017 in a statement on the White House website :
quote_txt: "In our nation’s capital, killings have risen by 50 percent."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2017 in a Tweet:
quote_txt: "The White House removed its climate change web page. And the healthcare, civil rights and LGBT sections."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2017 in remarks at the CIA:
quote_txt: "The media ... sort of made it sound like I had a feud with the intelligence community."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2017 in a speech at the Women's March.:
quote_txt: "Pads and tampons (are) still taxed when Viagra and Rogaine are not."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "That was the largest audience to witness an inauguration, period."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "The exodus of citizens from New York State has been growing."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2017 in a statement on the White House website:
quote_txt: "Our Navy has shrunk from more than 500 ships in 1991 to 275 in 2016."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2017 in his inaugural address:
quote_txt: "We've made other countries rich while the wealth ... of our country has dissipated over the horizon."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2017 in a speech:
quote_txt: California has "the highest poverty rate in the nation" when considering the U.S. Census Bureau’s Supplemental Poverty Measure.

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2017 in a news conference:
quote_txt: Wisconsin’s middle class is the "most diminished" in the United States.

description_txt: stated on November 28, 2016 in during an Illinois House committee hearing on a workers’ compensation reform bill:
quote_txt: "Businesses are leaving Illinois. I think, statistically, that can be proven to be false through the Bureau of Labor Statistics. No net businesses left Illinois."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2017 in a speech to business leaders:
quote_txt: Says North Carolinians are "already paying for" Medicaid expansion, even though the state hasn’t expanded Medicaid.

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2017 in a Senate confirmation hearing for Betsy DeVos.:
quote_txt: "[The Foundation for Individual Rights] is the recipient of donations from [DeVos] totaling about 25,000 bucks over four years."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2017 in a letter:
quote_txt: The uninsured rate in California reached "a historic low of 7.4 percent in 2016."

description_txt: stated on December 8, 2016 in an appearance on Fox News:
quote_txt: "In the last decade, 73% of new jobs (in Wisconsin) have come from Madison."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2017 in a viral image on the Internet:
quote_txt: Thirteen Democratic senators "voted against cheaper medicines" and took millions from "big pharma since 2011."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2017 in her Senate confirmation hearing:
quote_txt: "I would imagine that there's probably a gun in the school (in Wapiti, Wyo.) to protect from potential grizzlies."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "Florida is ranked 50th in the nation for mental health care funding."

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2017 in a media briefing:
quote_txt: Obamacare "is in what the actuaries call a death spiral."

description_txt: stated on November 25, 2016 in a op-ed for The State Journal-Register in Springfield:
quote_txt: "House Bill 6627 also requires the applicant to attest to their eligibility to vote, as is required by the National Voter Registration Act and used by all other states that have (automatic voter registration)."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2017 in a Senate confirmation hearing:
quote_txt: "We give (foreign aid) to developing countries, and 70 percent of it's stolen off the top."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2017 in an interview with NBC's 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: The inauguration of Donald Trump "will be the first one that I miss since I've been in Congress."

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2017 in a CNN story:
quote_txt: "By funding the authorization that’s already happened a decade ago (in the Secure Fence Act of 2006), we could start the process of meeting Mr. Trump’s campaign pledge to secure the border."

description_txt: stated on December 10, 2016 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "Social Security is in trouble (it’s going bankrupt by 2034)."

description_txt: stated on January 5, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: The federal government is prohibited "from negotiating lower prescription drug prices for our senior citizens."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Georgia’s 5th congressional district, represented by John Lewis, is "in horrible shape and falling apart (not to mention crime infested)."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2017 in an interview on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "The vast majority of people that got insurance under President Obama's Obamacare, the Affordable Care Act, got it through Medicaid."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2017 in a press conference at Trump Tower:
quote_txt: "Paying for a hotel room is not a gift or a present and it has nothing to do with an office. It's not an emolument."
